Topic.Title: from zerohedge on the cybermonday nonsense:

Message.Msg: race, reg. "What of stock sales from option exercises?", just wanted to point out that Amazon issues RSUs which are like no-cost options and no money is received by Amazon at award nor at exercise. However, a contingent compensation expense is recorded at fair value at time of award and is expensed at time of exercise. RSUs being exercised have actually been contributing to declining cash flow as Amazon has been mopping up the dilution with share buybacks.

Message.Title: Oh,Oh, California sales down roughly 30% because of sales tax
Message.Msg: Management says the sales growth for taxing states is no different than growth in no-tax states. I believe that is 100% correct for ongoing operations, but they attempt to hide the obvious fact that sales in no-tax states drop 20% after they begin collecting tax. They grow the same after that point, but from a much smaller base. When any management lies in this fashion, run for the hills.

Message.Title: Another amazing SCAM fact - EPS range for FY13
Message.Msg: For a company worth more than $100B in market cap and with $60B in revenue, the analysts know nothing about them. The EPS uncertainly looks like that of a startup rather than the 22nd biggest market cap in the world. Don't tell me this is becuase they are investing - they can forecast that to the investment community like everyone else. They choose not to because they get higher valuation this way. By definition this means the price targets, reports, and analysis is meaningless. Let's compare AMZN EPS estimates with top competitors: AAPL: 43.63 (low) - 68.69 (High), Mean = $57.95 (-25%, +19% from mean), 44% spread GOOG: $42.24 (low) - $51.20 (high), Mean = $46.72 (-9%, +10% from mean), 19% spread eBAY: $2.29 (low) - $2.96 (high), Mean = $2.73 (-16%, +8% from mean), 24% spread AMZN: $0.45 (low) - $3.73 (high), Mean = $1.76 (-74%, +112% from mean), 186% spread What a joke ... basically the street has no idea what AMZN will do next year and yet this deserves a FWD P/E range of 65 to 540 on 5Q's from now earnings? Note that AMZN also has a significant skew where are some outliers in the high-end of the range that are pulling up the Mean significantly. That means the AMZN is only stock above where the median estimate is well below mean. More to the scam.

Message.Msg: Earlier today Cramer was commenting on the cost of capital for Amazon. This is EXACTLY why the trading games of the capital markets are undermining our national competitiveness (rewarding malinvestment and punishing companies like INTC that focus on productive investment). They've artificially lowered the cost of capital for domestic consumer facing companies... So, we invest in consumption instead of productivity and production. The MOST IMPORTANT change that should be made to tax law is changing the LT capital gains holding period (increasing it normal income rates under 2-3 years, holding it at 20% for up to 5 years and keeping it at 15% or better yet TAKING IT TO ZERO for 5 years or more). That will lead to a return to investing by institutional longs and it will end the algo premium scalping / short squeeze games in the process. With that, capital will return to the market (and to the start ups and small companies that create jobs). Be patient. Amazon has some major weaknesses which will become apparent as stress increases...

Message.Msg: Is not set up as a stock that grinds lower. It is called a trap door stock. There have been many over the years that have the same trading pattern. You wake up one day and the bottom falls out. this happens when a stock is held up by multiple desks who simply won't let it fall much. One day someone cracks first and bingo the trap door is sprung. Market makers have to get their protection in place before anyone can let it go.

Topic.Title: Living Social could hurt this patent of Local Corp

Message.Msg: Groupon (Groupon Now), Living Social (Instant), Foursquaref, eBay's Milo (Nasdaq: EBAY), Jiwire's NearbyNow, Retailigence and Goodzer could hurt this patent "Patent #8,032,427 related to location based product search appears to encompass core aspects of services being offered by Groupon (GRPN) (Groupon Now), Living Social (Instant) and Foursquare; and is part and parcel of the product search functionalities offered by eBay's Milo (Nasdaq: EBAY), Gannett's ShopLocal (NYSE: GCI), Jiwire's NearbyNow, Retailigence and Goodzer. Source: Seeking Alpha
